topics.title: HTML Elements
topics.desc: HTML elements are building blocks, defined by a start tag, content, and an end tag.

topics.title: HTML Attributes
topics.desc: HTML attributes provide additional information about elements, such as id, class, src, href, etc.

topics.title: HTML Headings
topics.desc: HTML headings are defined with <h1> to <h6> tags.

topics.title: HTML Paragraphs
topics.desc:

tag. They are block-level elements.

topics.title: HTML Links
topics.desc: HTML links are created using the <a> tag with href attribute.

topics.title: HTML Images
topics.desc: Images are inserted using the tag with src and alt attributes.

topics.title: HTML Lists
topics.desc: HTML supports ordered and unordered lists.

topics.title: HTML Tables
topics.desc: HTML tables are created using <table>, <tr>, <td>, and <th> tags.

topics.title: HTML Forms
topics.desc: Forms are used to collect user input. They contain input fields, checkboxes, radio buttons, etc.

topics.title: HTML Semantic Elements
topics.desc: Semantic elements clearly describe their meaning, e.g., <header>, <footer>, <article>, <section>.

topics.title: HTML Iframes
topics.desc: An iframe is used to embed another webpage inside the current page.

topics.title: HTML Responsive Design
topics.desc: Responsive design uses meta tags and CSS media queries.
topics.code:
<meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0'>
<style>
  body { font-family: Arial; }

    body { background-color: lightblue; }
  }
